page.title: 18People's Viewpoints
page.content: I interviewed several people around Tipton ranging from 18 to 60 years of age.A large percentage of the younger age group commented on the fact that there are few public amenities such as cinemas and youth clubs.They also complained about the mass unemployment due to a large proportion of factories closing down.Young married couples complained about the lack of accommodation or the poor state of that which they are expected to live in.The older age group had different views.They said Tipton is now a cleaner place to live in since it is now a smokeless zone.Most of them agreed about the lack of public amenities.Some even mentioned the lack of community spirit.Most young and old mentioned the growth in private housing which gives more people a chance to buy a house.
